intro: Astragalus athranthus, commonly known as the redhead pea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Mongolia. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in arid and rocky soils. Astragalus athranthus is often found in alpine and steppe environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
